title: Bard's Chimes need to give more EXP as his level gets higher
body: Bard's got one major problem with his roaming ways: he inevitably ends up lower level than every other support, even if he's collecting chimes non-stop. Can his chimes be adjusted to give extra experience either according to Bard's level or the duration of the game?

replies.body: Yeah, the XP rewards for Chimes could potentially stand to be higher. We're planning on testing Chimes giving more XP based off game time this week, along with a couple of other small Bard buffs (an adjustment so Chimes don't spawn deep in the enemy jungle in the first 5 minutes and a slight increases to the speed/range of Q). We're keeping buff testing light on him for a little bit since we're still assessing the impact of the 5.7 changes. He's definitely in a significantly better spot, and probably still has some untapped performance, but's probably still on the weak side too.

I have to agree; he feels better than ever to play right now. Had a game yesterday where I was dominant for MOST of the game, but during the midgame I definitely had trouble keeping up with EXP. I think exp based on game time is probably the best way to do it.

Hope you read this. Another very small potential improvements : make the chimes spawn on minutes instead of 50 seconds. Simply make an extra chimes once in a while to compensate.

I found if I control where I am and take a step back when the chimes spawn, I make much less chimes spawn on the wrong side of the map by myself. The only problem is, I'd need to memorize exactly every multiple of 50 seconds to do it reliably, which seem to me like a very elitist thing to do. If they were spawning every minute, it would be much easier to use that trick.

They could add a buff with a cooldown timer so you can see when the next chime spawn is coming if you watch your buff area.  That way they don't need to change the math but players don't need to memorize each spawn time either.

More work than not having to -10 every time.
In a reaction based game such as League, distraction can mean death, even if it is for a fraction of a second.
So for every moment you are -10, is a moment you put yourself at greater risk.

* **[Fates Intertwined]** - Caretaker's Shrine now also gives a 20 second buff to any ally that uses it. While the ally has the buff, Bard shares experience in the area as if he were there (if he isn't). Here are a few issues I have whenever I play as Bard {{champion:432}} , despite having a lot of fun with him whenever I play and people loving it when I do. Note I am NOT a ranked player, and this may partially be my fault.

1. He does extremely little damage, even by support standards. While Cosmic Binding does decent poke at the very beginning of the game, by mid game his only offensive spell is essentially null. His meeps also seem to offer little in the way of help beyond very early game, and the low range of his attacks and Q make defending a marksman or himself hard to do without being outpoked. He also has the worst waveclear I've seen on a support (which I've used Zz'rot Portal to help compensate for), even other supports have some form of area damage or natural damage resistance. It makes defending especially hard.

2. His ultimate is infuriating to use. Almost any time I've used it I've had someone complain. I've accidentally defended enemies from friendly ultimates, frozen teammates while they were chasing, protected enemies during tower dives (I saw a Lucian jump into one before we dove the tower, it was pretty smart of him), or just simply saw the fight go on as if nothing happened. It seems like there are extremely few situations where it can really be used to your team's benefit, as it effects EVERYONE in a way that requires tight and singular judgement to make effectively (as in a certain item that only affects you personally). This is probably my fault, but it's still hard to judge when you can't predict everyone's movements carefully.

3. He seems to have little presence in teamfights. It may be telling that he's suggested to build full tank despite not having defensive scalings, consistent damage, or any very close-range utilities like true tanks do. I spend most teamfights baiting and skirting around the fight and using Cosmic Binding to trap enemies, or just dying immediately. I also seem to perform just as well (sometimes good, sometimes awful) no matter what I build. I won a game going tanky AD debuffer, seem to have middling success with full AP, and do iffy with tanky builds. His only scalings are extremely low, so maybe something that would suggest a build path would be good for him.

4. As mentioned above, there seems to be no truly good build for him besides Boots of Mobility. I've tried items like Black Cleaver and Wit's End in one game, Rabadon's in another, and Frozen Heart in another, but have the same success with him. This may not be a weakness, it may be, but I would appreciate a definite build path or set of build paths for him.

5. It can be difficult to collect chimes when you're losing. It's hard to come back from a losing game with him when the enemy team is scouring your jungle with Bard, and I've noticed that when I win, it's because the rest of my team is doing well and when I lose, I'm going 0/13/4 or somesuch stats. Also, when you have an aggressive lane against you, Bard can't collect chimes and needs to stay by the marksman, so he can't collect chimes and help the other lanes, and a cycle of defeat happens and the entire game goes down.

6. I don't know why he has the ultimate he does. I associate this character with high mobility and helping everyone on the team, and usually ultimates fit a character's theme. Bard's ultimate on the other hand, STOPS everything it touches and has a lot of potential to trap your own teammates. I think a mobility-based ultimate would suit him much better, either one that rushes Bard across a large distance (maybe like Pantheon's, but not dealing damage) would help him roam more safely or save losing teammates, or one that gives a huge speed boost to his allies would help him. A fun idea would be to have Bard jump a long distance and simultaneously slow enemies and speed up allies like Karma can. It would encourage a specific build (tanky) and fit his wandering and intervention theme more.

All in all, I think it's his hodgepodge design that's the problem, not necessarily raw power (though it may be an issue). It makes him difficult to build and really help teammates in a way that feels like a support. I'm sorry for not having suggestions for changes to make, but this is what I experience a lot.

I just really want his "5 more chimes needed, 4 more chimes needed, etc." icon to show you what the next effect he'll gain will be when you hover over it instead of having to hover over his passive icon and looking at the very bottom of the wall of text to see it.
Bard is the roaming sup that gets out roamed by every other support.

You have to be careful with bard buffs. He is already on the cusp of being a decent jungler (He already can clear with full health, it's just slow). It would be best to buff some of his utility/reliability instead of raw damage. Considering he is the lowest win rate support, and the second lowest win rate champion in the game, I think he can afford some buffs. For example:

General: The change on PBE where his auto attack range was increased to 550 was nice. Why was that taken away? Many champions that depend on ranged auto attacks have at least standard or higher. Zyra, Lulu, and Sona are good examples.

Passive: You already suggested what I was going to suggest for chimes, so this is fine.

Q: Q is just really slow. Would be nice if it was a little fast, or had a slightly longer range.

W: Late game, the heal isn't very useful since you can't sit around and wait for the full 10 seconds. The W is used more for the speed boost. It would be nice if the max heal timer went down with rank to say 5 seconds instead of staying at 10 the whole game. Or, it would be nice if the speed boost duration or intensity scaled with rank. Also, please make W more visible in brushes.

E: I think E is mostly fine. If anything, you could make it so allies travel faster through the portal at earlier ranks.

R: I think R needs more incentive to put points into it. Right now, I just get one point in R and level it last because the only thing that improves with ranks in the CD and it isn't even by much. R is Bard's true "one point wonder" skill, and I don't think many people have realized it yet...

This is an interesting point.  Maybe his R rank could have passive effects on his basic skills like Sona's?  She has a similar issue that the thing you're really taking it for is utility that doesn't (and really can't) improve with rank.

Each R rank makes W reach full charge 2 seconds faster, increases Q stun by 0.25 sec, and... IDK what to give E that's different from what it already gains from ranking up.  Heals allies who travel through it for 5/10/15% of their missing health?

Or R could leave some kind of buff/debuff on affected targets (or the area itself, updating as people enter/leave) for a few seconds after the stasis wears off, which could strengthen with rank.  Reduce damage dealt by enemies and reduce damage taken by allies, for example (the double whammy from hitting both sides of the same fight could be pretty darn strong -- maybe not "rumble ult is here, do you REALLY want to stay and fight on it?", but it's not necessarily crazy for it to have that level of influence even though it deals 0 damage by itself).

Also, seeing Apollo's comment below, a much simpler suggestion is that R rank could just significantly increase the spawn rate of chimes, because chimes already strengthen meeps and help Bard in other ways.

very true about the R thing, I figured it out only recently that there's no real reason to level it, I thought that if leveling R increased the spawn rate of Meeps, (while leveling E increased the spawn rate of chimes) passively, it'd give more incentive to level them, depending on the game you're having. 

The other buffs, as much as they might help, would be too much too soon. I think single (or double) changes that are significant but subtle, are more important than mass changes right now. I think range on his Q would help a lot (even more than speed), and more vision of heals in brush as even I lose track of them sometimes, but ultimately pick two things (three if you think the W change as a visual update) and stick to that, if everyone agrees on 1 or 2 small changes, i think they're more likely to happen than a whole list that will tip him into the overpowered realm
Oh ya, I dont think all the changes should happen at once. Maybe 2 at most. :)

I don't have a ton of experience on Bard, but the times I played him I felt pressured to pick up the chimes soon after they spawned. Since when you pick up more chimes the spawn rate of chimes increases. The faster you pick them up the faster Bard will grow. It would be nice for the cooldown on chime spawning to be reduced as the game goes on rather than by how many he picks up.
